oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Induction of hypocalcemia in non-lactating, non-pregnant Holstein cows fed negative DCAD rations with low, medium or high concentrations of calcium
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Prichard, A. P.
Wimmler, C. E.
Crump, P. M.
Rowson, A. D.
Bascom, S. S.
Nuzback, D. E.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Prepartum
hypocalcemia
diet
Calcium
Ca -DCAD
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Prepartum feeding of a negative dietary cation-anion difference (-DCAD) ration has proved to be an effective method of preventing hypocalcemia. However, the optimum Ca concentration to feed with -DCAD rations has not been determined. We conducted an experiment to assess the implications of feeding a low, medium, and high concentration Ca -DCAD ration on the ability of a cow to respond to an induction of hypocalcemia.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2017; 245
